title: UMhlathuze Local Municipality elections
text:
The <a href="uMhlathuze%20Local%20Municipality">uMhlathuze Local Municipality</a>l council consists of sixty-seven members elected by <a href="mixed-member%20proportional%20representation">mixed-member proportional representation</a>. Thirty-four councillors are elected by <a href="first-past-the-post%20voting">first-past-the-post voting</a> in thirty-four <a href="ward%20%28South%20Africa%29">wards</a>, while the remaining thirty-three are chosen from <a href="party%20list">party list</a>s so that the total number of party representatives is proportional to the number of votes received. 
The municipality was enlarged at the time of the <a href="South%20African%20municipal%20election%2C%202016">South African municipal election, 2016</a> when part of the disbanded <a href="Ntambanana%20Local%20Municipality">Ntambanana Local Municipality</a> was merged into it.
In the <a href="South%20African%20municipal%20election%2C%202016">election of 3 August 2016</a> the <a href="African%20National%20Congress">African National Congress</a> (ANC) won a majority of forty-three seats on the council.
In the <a href="2021%20South%20African%20municipal%20elections">2021 South African municipal elections</a> the ANC lost its majority, winning a plurality of twenty-seven seats on the council.
Results.

The following table shows the results of the 1916 election.
November 2021 election.
The following table shows the results of the 2021 election.
The <a href="African%20National%20Congress">African National Congress</a> lost its majority, and an <a href="Inkatha%20Freedom%20Party">Inkatha Freedom Party</a> (IFP) led coalition, supported by the <a href="Democratic%20Alliance%20%28South%20Africa%29">Democratic Alliance</a> (DA) and <a href="Economic%20Freedom%20Fighters">Economic Freedom Fighters</a> (EFF), took control of the municipality. Nkonzoyakhe Donda (IFP) was elected mayor, Nkululeko Ngubane (EFF) deputy mayor and Tobias Gumede (IFP) Speaker.
